dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, big news out of Washington this week, it looks like President Trump has, um, officially vetoed the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, big news out of Washington this week, it looks like President Trump has, um, officially vetoed the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Topline: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, after days of uncertainty surrounding his willingness to confront Beijing as he attempts to hammer out a trade deal with China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, it was kind of expected, right? Like, he’d been hinting at it for a while.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, it was kind of expected, right? Like, he'd been hinting at it for a while.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Until today it was unclear if Trump would sign the bill into law.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. But still, it's a huge move, especially given how much support that bill had in Congress.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. But still, it's a huge move, especially given how much support that bill had in Congress.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, was passed almost unanimously by both houses of Congress last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It passed almost unanimously! I mean, that’s rare these days. This was the one designed to, like, hold China accountable on Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It passed almost unanimously! I mean, that's rare these days. This was the one designed to, like, hold China accountable on Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, was passed almost unanimously by both houses of Congress last week. It would mandate that the president impose sanctions against people found to be violating human rights in Hong Kong and require the State Department to give Congress annual reports assessing whether China has encroached on Hong Kongs autonomy or clamped down on civil liberties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. It would have mandated sanctions against those violating human rights there, and required annual reports on Hong Kong's autonomy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. It would have mandated sanctions against those violating human rights there, and required annual reports on Hong Kong's autonomy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would mandate that the president impose sanctions against people found to be violating human rights in Hong Kong and require the State Department to give Congress annual reports assessing whether China has encroached on Hong Kongs autonomy or clamped down on civil liberties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, why the veto then? Was it all about the trade deal with China?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, why the veto then? Was it all about the trade deal with China?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much. He basically said he vetoed it out of "defiance" for President Xi, China, and even the people of Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much. He basically said he vetoed it out of defiance for President Xi, China, and even the people of Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a statement announcing the signing, Trump said he signed the bill out of respect for President Xi, China and the people of Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. So, trying not to rock the boat while he's, you know, trying to hammer out that trade agreement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh. So, trying not to rock the boat while he's, you know, trying to hammer out that trade agreement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's definitely the read. And Senator Marco Rubio, who actually supported the bill, he was pretty critical of the veto.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's definitely the read. And Senator Marco Rubio, who actually supported the bill, he was pretty critical of the veto.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. now has new and meaningful tools to deter further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kongs internal affairs, said Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: He said now the U.S. has "no new and useless tools" to encourage further influence from Beijing. Pretty strong words.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He said now the U.S. has no new and useless tools to encourage further influence from Beijing. Pretty strong words.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Crucial quote: The U.S. now has new and meaningful tools to deter further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kongs internal affairs, said Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. And this comes right after those huge turnout elections in Hong Kong, too. The timing is, um, really something.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. And this comes right after those huge turnout elections in Hong Kong, too. The timing is, um, really something.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following last weekends historic elections in Hong Kong that included record turnout, this new law could not be more timely in showing strong U.S. support for Hong Kongers long-cherished freedoms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it feels like a big blow to those pro-democracy protesters who had such a clear mandate there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it feels like a big blow to those pro-democracy protesters who had such a clear mandate there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Definitely. I mean, they've been out there for months now, fighting against Beijing's control.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Definitely. I mean, they've been out there for months now, fighting against Beijing's control.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pro-democracy protests erupted in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong months ago over a bill that would extradite those accused of committing a crime in Hong Kong to mainland China. ... the protests have become a larger movement against Beijings control over the city

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Started with that extradition bill, remember? Which has now kind of evolved.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Started with that extradition bill, remember? Which has now kind of evolved.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: News peg: Pro-democracy protests erupted in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong months ago over a bill that would extradite those accused of committing a crime in Hong Kong to mainland China. ... While the bill has been withdrawn from consideration, the protests have become a larger movement against Beijings control over the city

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. So, this veto just feels like it undermines all that, doesn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. So, this veto just feels like it undermines all that, doesn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. It’s a tricky balance for the administration, clearly.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. It's a tricky balance for the administration, clearly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, trying to play both sides, but in this case, it really feels like Hong Kong got the short end of the stick.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, trying to play both sides, but in this case, it really feels like Hong Kong got the short end of the stick.
